linked_items.description: Includes all content ids referenced in 'details'. This is a temporary measure to expand content ids for frontends which is planned to be replaced by a dependency resolution service.

content_owners.description: References pages of organisations responsible for maintaining a topic e.g. in case of Service Manual it's community pages 'Design community', 'Agile delivery community' etc

alpha_taxons.description: Prototype-stage taxonomy label for this content item

mainstream_browse_pages.description: Powers the /browse section of the site. These are known as sections in some legacy apps.

topics.description: Powers the /topic section of the site. These are known as specialist sectors in some legacy apps.

organisations.description: All organisations linked to this content item. This should include lead organisations.

lead_organisations.description: A subset of organisations that should be emphasised in relation to this content item. All organisations specified here should also be part of the organisations array.

policies.description: These are for collecting content related to a particular government policy.

policy_areas.description: A largely deprecated tag currently only used to power email alerts.

absolute_path.description: A path only. Query string and/or fragment are not allowed.

absolute_fullpath.description: A path with optional query string and/or fragment.

analytics_identifier.description: A short identifier we send to Google Analytics for multi-valued fields. This means we avoid the truncated values we would get if we sent the path or slug of eg organisations.

segments_mode.description: For prefix redirects, preserve or ignore the rest of the fullpath. For exact, preserve or ignore the querystring.
